page.title: 03LAND USE-FARMING.
page.content: The farming in this area is mainly arable with wheat,barley,oats,rapeseed oil and potatoes being the main crops grown.There are 14 farms in the Roos and Tunstall area,most of them being mixed farms with arable and livestock sections.The main livestock are pigs and cattle with small herds of sheep. The farmers with livestock tend to use the local markets of Hull and Beverley when buying and selling.There is an abbatoir in Roos, which is used by local farmers and butchers.It is only 7 years old. The majority of farms in Roos are situated at Northend,although there are some in "old" Roos, near the church.At Tunstall there 5 farms;these being situated in the village itself. Some of the farmers have fields which cannot be cultivated,as they are too near to cliffs,affected by erosion.
